name: InventoryLevel
description: A snapshot of the productâ€™s inventory condition in each site. For example, snapshot date, on-hand inventory, condition of the product.

fields.name: connection_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the data source (i.e. connection). Auto populated by Galaxy.

fields.name: on_hand_inventory
fields.description:
Inventory that is physically at the site; typically in eaches but marked as double in case customer deals in bulk goods (e.g. grain)

Denotes quantity of inventory in a given inventory condition; if no inventory condition is specified, this is equivalent to 'unrestricted' inventory

fields.name: allocated_inventory
fields.description: Inventory ear-marked for some outbound process (e.g. customer shipment), but specific products are not bound

fields.name: bound_inventory
fields.description: Inventory bound to some process (e.g. inventory picked to fulfill an order)

fields.name: quantity_uom
fields.description: Quantity unit of measure for inventory

fields.name: inv_condition
fields.description:
Condition of inventory (e.g. in QA, damaged). Inventory in different conditions will be in different rows. All values in different conditions are mutually exclusive

'Reserved' inventory condition values for [Galaxy] 2022:
"Unrestricted" (inventory is available)
"Inspection" (under quality or any other inspection)
"Returns" (typically goes to returns area)
"Blocked" (blocked for any reason)
"InTransfer" (will be used when there are 2 step SAP stock transfer; implementation has to make sure there is no duplication with transfer orders)
"Restricted" (Restricted for another reason - but not blocked)

Usage is determined by apps and customers
Customers can also populate their own values.

fields.name: db_creation_dttm
fields.description: Internal audit field - stores when the record was created

fields.name: db_updation_dttm
fields.description: Internal audit field - stores when the record was last updated

fields.name: source_update_dttm
fields.description: Date time stamp of the update made in the source system (SAP etc).

fields.name: source_event_id
fields.description: ID of the event created in the source system. Example: PO Receipt, Shipment schedule etc
